summary.para: The WINHTTP_CONNECTION_INFO structure contains the source and destination IP address of the request that generated the response.

remarks.para: When returns, the application can retrieve the source and destination IP address of the request that generated the response. The application calls with the WINHTTP_OPTION_CONNECTION_INFO option, and provides the WINHTTP_CONNECTION_INFO structure in the lpBuffer parameter.
The following code example shows the call to . Winsock2.h must be included before Winhttp.h when using the WINHTTP_OPTION_CONNECTION_INFO option.
If the original request was redirected, the WINHTTP_CONNECTION_INFO structure contains the IP address and port of the request that resulted from the first non-30X response.

summary.para: The size, in bytes, of the WINHTTP_CONNECTION_INFO structure.
A SOCKADDR_STORAGE structure that contains the local IP address and port of the original request.
A SOCKADDR_STORAGE structure that contains the remote IP address and port of the original request.
